fact.author: Robert L. Glass
fact.fact-text: The working environment has a profound impact on productivity and quality.

fact.author: Robert L. Glass
fact.fact-text: New tools/techniques cause an initial loss of productivity/quality.

fact.author: Robert L. Glass
fact.fact-text: Quality IS: a collection of attributes.

fact.author: Robert L. Glass
fact.fact-text: Quality is NOT: user satisfaction, meeting requirements, achieving cost/schedule, or reliability.

fact.author: Robert L. Glass
fact.fact-text: You can manage quality into a software product.

fact.author: Robert L. Glass
fact.fact-text: Random test input is a good way to optimize testing.

fact.author: Robert L. Glass
fact.fact-text: Software is usually tested at best at the 55-60 percent (branch) coverage level.

fact.author: Robert L. Glass
fact.fact-text: 100 percent coverage is still far from enough.

fact.author: Robert L. Glass
fact.fact-text: Test tools are essential, but many are rarely used.

fact.author: Robert L. Glass
fact.fact-text: Test automation rarely is. Most testing activities cannot be automated.
